title: 2017 Puebla earthquake
summary: The 2017 Puebla earthquake struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with an estimated magnitude of Mw7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds. Its epicenter was about 55 km (34 mi) south of the city of Puebla. The earthquake caused damage in the Mexican states of Puebla and Morelos and in the Greater Mexico City area, including the collapse of more than 40 buildings.[3][4][5] 370 people were killed by the earthquake and related building collapses, including 228 in Mexico City,[6][7] and more than 6,000 were injured.[8]
